qas.question: The time span that is counted as the classical for the Greeks is from eras ?

answers.text: classical period of Greek civilization covers a time spanning from the early 5th century BC to the death of Alexander the Great, in 323 BC

qas.question: Are there some discrepancies among scholars for the distinction of the period ?

answers.text: this period into 'Classical', from the end of the Persian wars to the end of the Peloponnesian War, and 'Fourth Century', up to the death of Alexander

qas.question: What is so well known about this period ?

answers.text: It is so named because it set the standards by which Greek civilization would be judged in later eras

qas.question: What shiny other name is this time also called ?

answers.text: The Classical period is also described as the "Golden Age" of Greek civilization

qas.question: What did the Greeks do that made it possible for the expansion and growth of the opposite of the Eastern Civilization ?

answers.text: civilization, and its art, philosophy, architecture and literature would be instrumental in the formation and development of Western culture.
